channel.title: Cloud Resume Dev Log
channel.description: Updates and notes from building my AWS Cloud Resume.

item.title: Look! Another Post!
item.description: I can't really even believe it myself, but here we are with another riveting blog post. I'm so excited to share more random thoughts with you all. The only problem is, I have no interesting thoughts to even share. My mind is just a vast abyss of nothing really going on a lot of the time. But hey, what are you gonna do?

item.title: CI/CD Integration with GitHub Actions
item.description: So here we are, at the point where I have successfully set up my CI/CD pipeline (mostly) for the resume site. I don't have much else to say about it at the moment, since it's very late and I think I'm done for the night. But this post is to celebrate. And to give me an excuse to have another change to push to the repo. Peace out.

item.title: Sister's Birthday
item.description: Today is my sister's birthday! Here is another test blog post that should automatically show up on my site once I run this python script again. Thanks for being here.

item.title: First Test Blog Post
item.description:
I grew up on Newgrounds, Winamp skins, and Flash games, so when I started the Cloud Resume Challenge I knew I didn’t want another minimalist template. Instead, I rebuilt a late-90s portal UI using nothing but HTML and CSS.

The site is a fixed-width, 760px layout with chunky borders, tiny Verdana text, and high-contrast button panels. Under the hood, though, it’s a static S3 site fronted by CloudFront with HTTPS, caching, and versioned assets.
